intro: Zeuxinella vietnamica, commonly known as the Vietnam zeuxinella, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Vietnam. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of herbs, shrubs, and trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in primary forest undergrowth. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a vulnerable species and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
